info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Catawba, western Lincoln, northwestern Cleveland and southeastern Burke Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Morganton, or 4 miles northeast of Casar, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Belwood, Casar, Fallston, South Mountains State Park, Pleasant Grove, Cooksville, Propst and Vale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
